description.value: You peek into the future. Choose a particular goal or activity you plan to engage in within 1 week, or an event you expect might happen within 1 week. You learn a cryptic clue or piece of advice that could help with the chosen event, often in the form of a rhyme or omen.

You unleash a ray of entropy that rapidly and indiscriminately decays matter. Make a ranged spell attack against the target's AC. On a hit, the target takes 5d8 void damage, or it takes 2d6 persistent acid damage and is glitching 1 if it has the tech trait. On a critical hit, double the damage, and if the creature has the tech trait, it's glitching 2 and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Stunned]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1 die.

You alter gravity's effects on you. You treat gravity as if it were your choice of one step higher or lower (for example, if you were in an area of low gravity, you could choose either standard gravity or zero-g). While the spell is active, you reduce the distance of any forced movement that would affect you by 5 feet (minimum 0 feet), and you ignore being clumsy and untethered because of gravity effects on you. You can Dismiss the spell.

You telepathically share the sensation of agonizing pain with a creature. The target takes 3d12 mental damage and attempts a Will save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Clumsy]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Clumsy]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute.

Heightened (6th) The spell targets up to four creatures and deals 6d12 mental damage.

The target hears ominous sounds containing unspeakable mysteries from beyond the stars that disorient its mind. The target attempts a Will save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The target hears the strange whispers, becoming @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target begins to wander aimlessly, using each action to Step in a random direction. When it moves, the target takes the safest route and doesn't enter hazardous terrain. The spell has a duration of 1 minute or until a creature uses a hostile action against the target.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target babbles incoherently. Any creature that begins its turn within 20 feet of the target must attempt a Will saving throw. On a failure, it must use its first action on its next turn to Step in a random direction and becomes immune to this spell for 24 hours. This is an incapacitation effect.

You gain a vague glimpse of the future. During the casting of this spell, ask about the results of a particular course of action. The spell can predict results up to 30 minutes into the future and reveal the GM's best guess among the following outcomes: good, bad, mixed (the results will be a mix of good and bad), and nothing (there won't be particularly good or bad results).

The GM rolls a secret @Check[flat|dc:6|showDC:all|traits:secret]. On a failure, the result is always "nothing." This makes it impossible to tell whether a "nothing" result is accurate. If anyone asks about the same topic as the first casting of augury during an additional casting, the GM uses the secret roll result from the first casting. If circumstances change, though, it's possible to get a different result.

You gain a vague glimpse of the future. During the casting of this spell, ask about the results of a particular course of action. The spell can predict results up to 30 minutes into the future and reveal the GM's best guess among the following outcomes: good, bad, mixed (the results will be a mix of good and bad), and nothing (there won't be particularly good or bad results).

The GM rolls a secret @Check[flat|dc:6|showDC:all|traits:secret]. On a failure, the result is always "nothing." This makes it impossible to tell whether a "nothing" result is accurate. If anyone asks about the same topic as the first casting of augury during an additional casting, the GM uses the secret roll result from the first casting. If circumstances change, though, it's possible to get a different result.

The target's form appears blurry. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Concealed]. As the nature of this effect still leaves the target's location obvious, the target can't use this concealment to Hide or Sneak.

You sense the presence of thinking creatures around you. You detect the presence or absence of thoughts from conscious creatures that have Intelligence modifiers of –3 or higher. You can choose to ignore the thoughts of creatures you're familiar with so they don't interfere with your detection of other thoughts. The spell can penetrate some barriers, but 3 feet of dirt or wood, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of metal, a thin sheet of lead, or any force barrier blocks it. Creatures who are immune to mental effects are immune to detection by this spell.

Heightened (4th) You detect the number of thinking minds and whether or not the creatures are telepathic. Creatures with telepathy have louder thoughts than creatures who don't have telepathy and might be able to sense your intrusion, at the GM's discretion.

Your gaze pierces through illusions and finds @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Invisible] creatures and spirits. You can see invisible creatures as though they weren't invisible, although their features are blurred, making them @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Concealed] and difficult to identify. You can also see incorporeal creatures, like ghosts, phased through an object from within 10 feet of an object's surface as blurry shapes seen through those objects. Subtler clues also grant you a +2 status bonus to checks you make to disbelieve illusions.

Heightened (5th) This spell has a duration of 8 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spell-effects.Item.Spell Effect: See the Unseen]

You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt. Enemies in the area must succeed at a Will save or take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area. Once per round on subsequent turns, you can Sustain the spell to increase the emanation's radius by 10 feet and force enemies in the area that weren't yet affected to attempt another saving throw.

Bane can counteract @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.Bless].

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spell-effects.Item.Spell Effect: Bane]

You push into the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals 1d6 mental damage, with a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Stunned]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.Invisibility Potion]) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

You condense a beam of mind-assaulting eldritch energy from the dark spaces between the stars and fire it at a target. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target's AC. If you hit, you deal 2d6 mental damage. On a critical success, you deal double damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

You sap the target's strength, depending on its Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 1} until the start of your next turn.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 3} for 1 minute.

You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Frightened]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Fleeing] for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

You overload a creature's mind with a glut of psychic information or divine judgments. The mental onslaught deals 2d6 mental damage. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

You create a floating, magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and levitates it slowly up to 20 feet in any direction. When you Sustain the spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.

target.value: 1 unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less
1 unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less
1 unattended object of light Bulk or less

description.value:
You call upon the Void to harm life force. The target takes 2d4 void damage with a basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 1} until the start of your next turn.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Upgrades: 1

This bladed hoop is carved from a chunk of aucturnite and sculpted to resemble a planet's ring. The material has mysteriously appeared light-years from Aucturn's original orbit.

Trigger The ichor lord is dealt piercing or slashing damage

Effect Hallucinogenic ichor spurts from the ichor lord's wound, dealing @Damage[1d6[mental]|options:area-damage] damage to non-orocoran creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] centered on the ichor lord (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save).

An orocoran's stomach fluids are laced with hallucinogens due to their consumption of the ichor-like birthing fluids expelled by Aucturn during the hatching of the Newborn.

A creature hit with the projectile vomit must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.Confused] for 1 round (1d4 rounds on a critical failure).

Requirements The ichor lord is touching solid ground

Frequency once per hour

Effect With a psychic cry to the Newborn, the ichor lord tears open the earth, causing a geyser of hallucinogenic ichor to burst from the ground within 100 feet. This geyser occupies a 50-foot-tall cylinder with a 10-foot radius base. The base of this geyser must be on the ground or a similar solid surface, and the geyser must be oriented vertically. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning],4d6[mental]|options:area-damage]{4d6 bludgeoning damage and 4d6 mental damage}, with a @Check[reflex|dc:28] save. A creature pushed into the air by the geyser can't be pushed beyond the top of the geyser. After being pushed into the air, a creature falls unless it's flying, is in zero gravity, or has some other means of staying aloft in its current environment, taking falling damage as normal.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and isn't pushed into the air.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is pushed 20 feet into the air.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is pushed 40 feet into the air. The geyser continues to flow for 1 minute, gently raining ichor in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] centered on the geyser's base. An orocoran in the area of this rain can drink the ichor once per round as a single action with the manipulate trait; if they do, they become invigorated, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls and resistance 5 to physical damage until the beginning of their next turn.

Frequency once per round

Requirements A creature within reach of the orocoran's proboscis is taking persistent bleed damage

Effect The orocoran flicks out their proboscis and sups on the flowing blood of their enemy. The orocoran regains Hit Points equal to the target's persistent bleed value.

languages.details: Common cant speak any languages, Telepathy 100 feet

details.publicNotes:
Orocoran ichor lords are blessed by the Newborn—ichor flows through their veins, and they can conjure short-lived fonts of ichor. Most gather desperate orocorans around them, controlling their brethren through access to ichor.

Native to the now-destroyed planet of Aucturn, orocorans are foul and desperate creatures, cast adrift in space as they yearn to consume once more the essence of the Newborn god or fragments of the womb it gestated within. They're irritable, violent, and utterly anguished.

While some orocorans have broken free of their addiction and regained their clarity of mind and sense of self, the orocorans presented here are those who still rely on Aucturn's eldritch fluids.
